title: Deterministic convolution is nondeterministically being nondeterministic on CUDNN 7
body_html:
Here are the most recent build logs with this problem:

  • https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3-test/236/console
  • https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py2-test/235/console
  • https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py2-test/228/console
  • https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3-test/210/console
  • https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3-test/207/console
  • https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py2-test/202/console

The problem appears to only happen on CUDA9/CuDNN7. NVIDIA did not know of any known issues with deterministic convolution on M60s. The problem has reproduced on multiple GPU workers (0 and 2) so it is unlikely to be a worker misconfiguration.

Error traces:

23:59:46 ======================================================================
23:59:46 FAIL: test_Conv2d_deterministic_cudnn (__main__.TestNN)
23:59:46 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
23:59:46 Traceback (most recent call last):
23:59:46   File "test_nn.py", line 1863, in test_Conv2d_deterministic_cudnn
23:59:46     self.assertEqual(conv1.weight.grad.data, conv2.weight.grad.data, prec=0.0)
23:59:46   File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/test/common.py", line 204, in assertEqual
23:59:46     assertTensorsEqual(x, y)
23:59:46   File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/test/common.py", line 196, in assertTensorsEqual
23:59:46     self.assertLessEqual(max_err, prec, message)
23:59:46 AssertionError: 9.5367431640625e-07 not less than or equal to 0.0 : 
23:59:46 
23:59:46 ----------------------------------------------------------------------

22:49:20 ======================================================================
22:49:20 FAIL: test_Conv2d_deterministic_cudnn (__main__.TestNN)
22:49:20 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
22:49:20 Traceback (most recent call last):
22:49:20   File "test_nn.py", line 1863, in test_Conv2d_deterministic_cudnn
22:49:20     self.assertEqual(conv1.weight.grad.data, conv2.weight.grad.data, prec=0.0)
22:49:20   File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/test/common.py", line 204, in assertEqual
22:49:20     assertTensorsEqual(x, y)
22:49:20   File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/test/common.py", line 196, in assertTensorsEqual
22:49:20     self.assertLessEqual(max_err, prec, message)
22:49:20 AssertionError: 4.76837158203125e-07 not less than or equal to 0.0

CC @prigoyal

* https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3-test/236/console

The problem appears to only happen on CUDA9/CuDNN7. NVIDIA did not know of any known issues with deterministic convolution on M60s. The problem has reproduced on multiple GPU workers (0 and 2) so it is unlikely to be a worker misconfiguration.
